result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea E Koller

defendant.name: Koller, Andrea E
defendant.address: W289 S2343 County Road DT, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
2:38 PM Defendant Andrea E Koller in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Andrea E Koller.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Nimmer makes a statement to the court and requests more time to obtain a valid drivers license.  
Atty Nimmer requests a new plea and sentencing date. 
State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:08 AM Defendant Andrea E Koller in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Andrea E Koller.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Nimmer has not received electronic discovery and does request that information. 
Atty Nimmer updates the court with the outstanding issues in this matter. 
State has no comment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:38 AM Defendant Andrea E Koller in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Nimmer makes a statement to the court and is waiting for discovery in this matter. 
Court sets a status date.
  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

File not called on the record.09:40 AM Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court.   Defendant Andrea E Koller did not appear.   Alyssa Marilee Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Nimmer requests a new date.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:16 AM Defendant Andrea E Koller in court with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer David Rivera, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Thompson.
Cross examination by attorney Nimmer.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Amanda Nimmer has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

03:03 PM Defendant Andrea E Koller in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
